task_summary: Detect the T-shaped block and the goal, align the circular end-effector to make gentle contact, then execute repeated pushes first downward and then rightward to drive the block into the target region, finally retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop robot with a circular end-effector must push a gray T-shaped block to a marked target area. The sequence begins with perception of both the block and goal, followed by precise alignment. After establishing contact, the robot performs short, repeatable pushes that translate the T along orthogonal directions to approximate a diagonal path toward the goal. Motions are conservative to maintain control at 10 Hz sensing/control. The run ends with a short retreat to clear the view.
stepwise_plan: Detect T-shaped block and goal marker.
Approach and align with the T block.
Lower until gentle contact is detected.
Execute three short pushes to the right.
success_criteria: T block ends within the target bounds
No loss of contact causing large rotations
failure_and_recovery: If perception fails, re-run detection; if alignment/contact fails, re-approach; if pushes drift orientation excessively, re-align before continuing.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when pushes complete and the final retreat finishes.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Approach and align to push direction.
Lower tool until contact is sensed.

failure_modes: Misalignment causing rotation of the T
recovery_strategy: Abort and Retreat if contact becomes unstable
assumptions: Target outline appears blue in frames though instruction says green; treated as the same entity.
Workspace axes inferred; diagonal motion approximated by orthogonal pushes (down then right).

expected_success_criteria: T block within the target boundary after second push series
